integrations.title: What is Mulebot?
integrations.description: Mulebot app is one of the core areas of Kubera, covering the storage operational support of Kubernetes clusters. DevOps developers and admins get the analytics of their OpenEBS volumes deployed across multi-cloud kubernetes clusters right into their Slack channels. Its functionality extends beyond just simply providing alerts and providing a way to query any configuration and status from Slack, It goes all the way to interact with DevOps developers and admins to manage the yaml config files in their CI/CD system.

description.passage1: Mulebot will enhance user's experience with the Kubera by allowing them to query the clusters' configuration of Kubera. First of all, user will install this app into his/her slack-workspace. During installation,user has to select a channel to post response for slash commands and alerts. (Note : Either select a channel in which you are present or create a new channel in your workspace first and then select that channel during installation), after selecting a Slack channel and clicking on authorize button, user will be redirected to https://director.mayadata.io where user has to select the clusters from the list of available clusters (one or more) in order to specify which cluster information user wants in his/her selected Slack channel. User is prompted for authentication by https://director.mayadata.io if the login has not happened already.
description.passage2: User will be able to query the selected clusters in the selected channel only. User will not get any information outside that channel for the clusters mapped to that particular channel.

integrate.title: How to integrate with Slack?
integrate.instruction: Go through the following steps for integration:

steps.step2: Log In / Sign Up to MayaData.
steps.step4: In Kubera, click on ”Slack” on the left sidebar -> click on “Create a new Slack card” button.
steps.step5: Enter your Slack workspace credentials then enter your own Slack credentials.
steps.step6: Select a channel among the list of channels of your workspace to allow the bot to post the alerts and response to your queries.
steps.step7: Click on “Authorize” (you will be redirected to Kubera Slack configuration page to select clusters to map to the selected Slack channel).
steps.step8: Select one or more clusters from the list of clusters (clusters connected in Kubera) to map them to the selected Slack channel so that mulebot can post the alerts and respond to your queries related to these clusters in the selected Slack channel only.

integrate.note: Note - If you have not connected any cluster in Kubera, then you can proceed without selecting a cluster and can create a Slack connection. Once you have a connected cluster you can again edit and map a cluster with Slack connection from slack integration page.
